header.title: The best Fence & Concrete installation company in Los Angeles
bullets: Trusted Fence & Concrete repair and replacement with 2000+ reviews (4.8 rating)
FREE custom quote and video call for your onsite visit
Transparent pricing and top notch craftsmanship

Yelp.title: This was a first class experience. To start, their unofficial estimate on the web site before any contact was very accurate. Not many contractors will give you an accurate price on their web. Alan and Jorge managed the project with total professionalism, making sure everything went smoothly and that I was completely satisfied. Installation day went perfectly. The crew showed up on time, quickly demolished the old fence and proceeded with the installation of the new fence. Fence looks beautiful!
Yelp.name: Eric H.
Yelp.description: This was a first class experience. The fence looks beautiful!

Google.title: My experience with Ergeon was very positive. From the start the follow through was good, with Matias very friendly
Google.name: Ana R.
Google.description: My experience with Ergeon was very positive.

regulations.title: Permits & Regulations
regulations.description: See the undefined Permits & Regulations for undefined

faq.front-yard: 3.5 feet for R/RW zone, 6 feet for A/RA zone, and up to 8 feet with zoning approval
faq.side-yard: 3.5 feet on street side within 5 feet setback on reverse corner lots in R Zones, 6 feet if lot width < 40 feet or Hillside for A / RA / R  zones, 8 feet if lot width > 40 feet for A / RA / R  Zones.
faq.rear-max-height: 6 feet when lot width < 40 feet or Hillside, 8 feet  when lot width > 40 feet for A / RA / R  zones
faq.setback: 5 feet street side on reverse corner lots for R Zones, 3.5 feet street side on any corner lot for RW zone
faq.corner-lot-rules: Max 3.5 feet on Visibility Triangle Area (45 feet from the point of intersection of the extended curb lines or edges of roadway)

articles.description: If you’re looking to get a new fence in California, it’s important to know about the laws surrounding fences and home improvement projects. Our post will go over some important things to keep in mind.

When it’s time to get a new fence it’s important to always use a reputable, licensed, and insured contractor.  In this post, we’ll go over the main reasons why you should always use a licensed and insured fence contractor.
